channel.title: URGANT! NEED HELP! (This may be difficult)
channel.description:
OK I am running into a major problem with my server. I have no clue what the problem is?!
Let me lay it down.
I have a server from the InsidiaX source and client. I have edited a lot in the server so it is to how I want the server to be. Anyway I have [u][b]set everything I can see in the server and client files to my ip adress which is 121.***.***.29[/b][/u] I have also [u][b]taken out all of the 127.0.0.1 and replaced them with my server ip.[/b][/u] I have a No-ip so I can get it online and my no-ip is skaarjpk.servergame.com. I also have port forwarded it through my router on port 43594. (I am not sure if that is 'MY' port but its the port everyone uses.) I also made it open in utorrent and [u][b]I tested my 43594 port on a website and nothing is blocking it[/b][/u].
The server client has 300+ downloads and there is only 3 or 4 players on ever! I have had a problem with he cache auto downloading so I had to included it with the server client. [b][u]People that download the server have said to me they get an error that said 'Error connecting to server'[/u][/b] and once in a blue moon they can connect but then cannot after they log out. So this to me has just said it might be my internet connection. but it is a [b][u]direct connection into a router and never cuts out[/u][/b].
If anyone is willing to help out with this I will be sooo grateful because this is killing me, i'm sure its something simple but I just can't do it. I have Team Viewer and Skype.
[u][b]Please anybody help me with this!!! Anybody Give it a go it is just killing me!![/b][/u]

item.title: URGANT! NEED HELP! (This may be difficult)
item.dc:creator: @Krajix Krajix
item.description:
@Krajix wrote:

My server is not actually on at the moment, I shut everything off so there shouldn’t be a signal getting sent out for ‘skaarjpk.servergame.com’

P.S: Reply to my PM

Read full topic
item.source: URGANT! NEED HELP! (This may be difficult)

item.title: URGANT! NEED HELP! (This may be difficult)
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Krajix:

[quote]8.23.224.90, is this one of yours?

No that is not any of my Ips. What do you mean its linked to ‘the IP’ ? and yeah I just got it running on my computer. is there a way to extend the bandwidth?[/quote]

First, you can extend the bandwidth (or allow more bandwith) by asking your service provider, which may often result in them wanting more money. Unless you have unlimited bandwidth but there are a lot of devices using your internet.

Secondly, No-ip is a 3rd party application that takes a numeric IP such as 8.23.224.90 and turns it into a textual representation such as skaarjpk.servegame.com. This thought is generally to protect from hackers though, I went into cmd and typed ‘ping skaarjpk.servegame.com’ and it displayed that it is now pinging the numeric IP (8.23.224.90). If skaarjpk.servegame.com is set to disguise the numeric IP ‘8.23.224.90’ and that’s not your IP, this could be the problem. I’d recommend getting rid of No-IP and instead of typing in skaarjpk.servegame.com, type in your IP to connect to (the 121.***.***.29) let me know if any of these suggestions worked.

Read full topic
item.source: URGANT! NEED HELP! (This may be difficult)

item.title: URGANT! NEED HELP! (This may be difficult)
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

The skaarjpk.servegame.com is linked to the IP, 8.23.224.90, is this one of yours? Another problem may be that you’re hosting from your home network, which can’t support the bandwidth usage.

item.title: URGANT! NEED HELP! (This may be difficult)
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

So… what’s the problem? You think there’s something wrong because you only have a Server Population of 3-4 people? It’s probably because

I have a server from the InsidiaX source and client.

Nobody wants to play on an untouched Base, and everyone these days can recognize them as such.

Read full topic

item.title: URGANT! NEED HELP! (This may be difficult)
item.dc:creator: @Krajix Krajix
item.description:
@Krajix wrote:

OK I am running into a major problem with my server. I have no clue what the problem is?!

Let me lay it down.

I have a server from the InsidiaX source and client. I have edited a lot in the server so it is to how I want the server to be. Anyway I have set everything I can see in the server and client files to my ip adress which is 121.***.***.29 I have also taken out all of the 127.0.0.1 and replaced them with my server ip. I have a No-ip so I can get it online and my no-ip is skaarjpk.servergame.com. I also have port forwarded it through my router on port 43594. (I am not sure if that is ‘MY’ port but its the port everyone uses.) I also made it open in utorrent and I tested my 43594 port on a website and nothing is blocking it.

The server client has 300+ downloads and there is only 3 or 4 players on ever! I have had a problem with he cache auto downloading so I had to included it with the server client. People that download the server have said to me they get an error that said ‘Error connecting to server’ and once in a blue moon they can connect but then cannot after they log out. So this to me has just said it might be my internet connection. but it is a direct connection into a router and never cuts out.

If anyone is willing to help out with this I will be sooo grateful because this is killing me, i’m sure its something simple but I just can’t do it.
I have Team Viewer and Skype.

Please anybody help me with this!!! Anybody Give it a go it is just killing me!!
